intro: Maesa tongensis, commonly known as the Tongshan maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
